title: John 10: The Good Shepherd
content: There were many shepherds in Palestine during Jesus’ time. Good shepherds were known by the faithful way they cared for and protected their sheep. A true shepherd would walk ahead of the sheep and lead them rather than drive them from behind, and many shepherds even had individual names for their sheep. Unlike someone who was simply hired to take care of the sheep, a shepherd owned his sheep, and he would risk his life for the safety of any one of them. Because sheep trusted those good shepherds, they came when they were called, but they would not follow a stranger. In
you will read about how Jesus used these well-known ideas about sheep and shepherds to teach about His relationship to His followers.
also tells what Jesus said to and about those who refused to accept His teachings and who tried to condemn Him.
